definition:
A [*loop*]{} based at $x_0$ in a topological space $X$ is simply a
continuous map $f : [0,1]\to X$ with $f(0) = f(1) = x_0$.

The collection of all such loops, modulo homotopy equivalence, forms a
group known as the fundamental group.

More generally, the space of loops in $X$ based at $x_0$ with the
compact-open topology, represented by $\Omega_{x_0}$, is known as the
loop space of $X$. And one has the homotopy groups
$\pi_n(X,x_0) = \pi_{n-1}(\Omega_{x_0},\iota)$, where $\pi_n$ represents
the higher homotopy groups, and $\iota$ is the basepoint in
$\Omega_{x_0}$ consisting of the constant loop at $x_0$.
